meanings.definition: Relating to a parson or clergyman.
meanings.sent1: The parsonic robes were worn by the clergy during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The parsonic demeanor of the priest made the congregation feel at ease.
meanings.sent3: The parsonic hat looked comically oversized on the young priest.
meanings.sent4: Her parsonic voice echoed through the church, calming all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The parsonic presence of the minister filled the room with a sense of peace.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a parson.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a parsonic charm with its quaint decorations.
meanings.sent2: His parsonic attire included a black suit and a white collar.
meanings.sent3: The parsonic cat sat on the windowsill, observing the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The parsonic smile on her face showed kindness and understanding.
meanings.sent5: The parsonic mannerisms of the gentleman reminded everyone of a pastor.

meanings.definition: In the style or manner of a parson.
meanings.sent1: The play had a parsonic theme, with characters dressed as clergy.
meanings.sent2: Her parsonic speech pattern was soothing and reassuring.
meanings.sent3: The parsonic walk of the actor on stage elicited laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The parsonic gestures of the teacher reminded the students of a pastor.
meanings.sent5: The parsonic decor of the room created a peaceful atmosphere for the meeting.
